data:
1
00:00:00,547 --> 00:00:03,877
My father's daughter.
That's right.

2
00:00:03,967 --> 00:00:07,137
What's the matter,
you don't see the resemblance?

3
00:00:07,217 --> 00:00:09,467
Now, let's take it
from the top, friend.

4
00:00:09,557 --> 00:00:13,057
With a lot of detail.
What do you say?

5
00:00:13,187 --> 00:00:16,647
He had a bird with him.
Nearly pecked my face off.

6
00:00:16,727 --> 00:00:20,107
He told me to tell T-bird
that death was on its way.

7
00:00:20,187 --> 00:00:22,447
Whatever the fuck that means.

8
00:00:22,487 --> 00:00:26,277
Draven. He said his name
was Eric Draven.

9
00:00:27,367 --> 00:00:29,447
Want to relax
that thing now?

10
00:00:29,487 --> 00:00:34,167
This bird man, he just happened
to let you live, huh?

11
00:00:34,247 --> 00:00:38,627
You sure you ain't making all this up
just to save your own ass?

12
00:00:38,667 --> 00:00:41,377
I ain't making all this up.

13
00:00:41,457 --> 00:00:45,967
I ain't twisted
like you two fucks.

14
00:00:47,757 --> 00:00:49,887
All right.

15
00:00:54,557 --> 00:00:59,567
A boy and his bird.
Awful touching.

16
00:00:59,647 --> 00:01:03,317
Yeah.

17
00:01:09,827 --> 00:01:12,827
For fuck's sake, die, will ya?
Give me that thing.

18
00:01:19,747 --> 00:01:22,087
Thanks.

19
00:01:22,127 --> 00:01:24,417
Funboy said he saw
a black bird too.

20
00:01:24,507 --> 00:01:27,087
A big one.

21
00:01:27,177 --> 00:01:32,057
Then he choked to death
on his own blood.

22
00:01:32,137 --> 00:01:36,057
I'll have the janitor
come on up.

23
00:02:37,627 --> 00:02:39,877
You again.

24
00:02:39,967 --> 00:02:42,337
You lost or hungry?

25
00:02:42,387 --> 00:02:45,217
Hi.

26
00:03:03,157 --> 00:03:05,867
I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

27
00:03:05,947 --> 00:03:08,867
One part falls, it all falls!

28
00:03:08,947 --> 00:03:12,417
- You know how long it took us to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

29
00:03:12,457 --> 00:03:15,037
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

30
00:03:15,127 --> 00:03:17,207
Tin Tin was a dick.

31
00:03:17,297 --> 00:03:20,257
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

32
00:03:20,337 --> 00:03:24,547
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

33
00:03:24,637 --> 00:03:26,547
Fire it up!

34
00:03:29,137 --> 00:03:31,227
No Funboy.

35
00:03:31,307 --> 00:03:35,227
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

36
00:03:40,607 --> 00:03:43,697
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

37
00:03:43,777 --> 00:03:45,777
I'm on it.

38
00:04:16,437 --> 00:04:20,017
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

39
00:04:20,107 --> 00:04:24,737
I'm your passenger.

40
00:04:31,617 --> 00:04:33,787
Drive.

41
00:04:38,877 --> 00:04:40,667
What's all this
happy horseshit?

42
00:04:40,747 --> 00:04:42,877
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

43
00:04:48,297 --> 00:04:51,557
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

44
00:04:51,637 --> 00:04:55,637
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

45
00:05:02,607 --> 00:05:07,027
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

46
00:05:08,657 --> 00:05:11,527
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

47
00:05:11,617 --> 00:05:14,697
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

48
00:05:17,667 --> 00:05:21,877
You got that cream stuff?

49
00:05:21,917 --> 00:05:24,337
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

50
00:05:25,917 --> 00:05:28,927
What in the crap...

51
00:05:32,427 --> 00:05:35,267
Oh, look. Making us popular.

52
00:05:35,307 --> 00:05:38,017
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

53
00:05:43,607 --> 00:05:46,567
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

54
00:05:49,107 --> 00:05:51,277
Turn.

55
00:05:52,617 --> 00:05:55,367
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

56
00:05:55,447 --> 00:05:59,787
Right? Huh?

57
00:06:01,327 --> 00:06:03,837
Damn! Dead end!

58
00:06:09,217 --> 00:06:11,677
Look out!

59
00:06:15,007 --> 00:06:17,227
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

60
00:06:28,317 --> 00:06:32,567
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

61
00:06:36,237 --> 00:06:38,747
Shit! Shit!

62
00:06:45,877 --> 00:06:49,587
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

63
00:06:51,007 --> 00:06:54,467
T- bird!
I got you, man!

64
00:06:54,547 --> 00:06:56,927
Shit!

65
00:07:10,317 --> 00:07:12,607
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

66
00:07:12,697 --> 00:07:15,947
But I don't know what...
What? Huh? What?

67
00:07:15,987 --> 00:07:18,787
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

68
00:07:18,827 --> 00:07:21,957
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

69
00:07:21,997 --> 00:07:24,167
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

70
00:07:24,247 --> 00:07:27,497
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

71
00:07:27,587 --> 00:07:31,167
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

72
00:07:31,257 --> 00:07:34,677
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

73
00:07:34,757 --> 00:07:38,007
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

74
00:07:38,097 --> 00:07:43,017
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

75
00:07:44,597 --> 00:07:46,477
Did you send us
these complaints?

76
00:07:48,187 --> 00:07:51,527
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

77
00:07:51,567 --> 00:07:53,947
Does it get you sweaty?

78
00:07:54,027 --> 00:07:59,237
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

79
00:07:59,287 --> 00:08:03,367
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

80
00:08:03,537 --> 00:08:07,457
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

81
00:08:07,537 --> 00:08:11,007
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

82
00:08:11,047 --> 00:08:13,417
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

83
00:08:13,507 --> 00:08:17,967
T- bird...

84
00:08:18,047 --> 00:08:21,017
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

85
00:08:23,557 --> 00:08:27,727
T- bird.

86
00:08:27,807 --> 00:08:31,187
"Abashed the devil stood...

87
00:08:31,227 --> 00:08:34,197
and felt how awful goodness is."

88
00:08:34,277 --> 00:08:37,157
"And felt how awful goodness is."

89
00:08:51,207 --> 00:08:53,797
T- bird. T-bird.

90
00:09:44,177 --> 00:09:46,477
This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

91
00:09:46,557 --> 00:09:48,897
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

92
00:09:48,937 --> 00:09:53,317
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

93
00:09:53,397 --> 00:09:56,817
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

94
00:09:56,897 --> 00:10:02,277
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

95
00:10:02,327 --> 00:10:07,497
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

96
00:10:07,577 --> 00:10:11,207
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties...

97
00:10:11,287 --> 00:10:15,087
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

98
00:10:17,127 --> 00:10:19,837
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

99
00:10:19,927 --> 00:10:24,847
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

100
00:10:24,927 --> 00:10:29,057
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

101
00:10:29,137 --> 00:10:32,477
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

102
00:10:32,517 --> 00:10:37,647
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

103
00:10:37,687 --> 00:10:43,487
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

104
00:10:43,527 --> 00:10:48,787
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

105
00:10:51,287 --> 00:10:55,587
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

106
00:10:55,667 --> 00:10:57,877
Over easy.

107
00:10:59,967 --> 00:11:04,677
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

108
00:11:15,267 --> 00:11:17,527
Hey, Albrecht.

109
00:11:20,277 --> 00:11:23,197
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

110
00:11:23,277 --> 00:11:26,527
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

111
00:11:26,617 --> 00:11:30,827
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

112
00:11:30,907 --> 00:11:32,827
Arson was his specialty.

113
00:11:32,917 --> 00:11:34,877
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

114
00:11:34,957 --> 00:11:38,877
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'- shit.

115
00:11:38,957 --> 00:11:41,217
Come here.

116
00:11:44,967 --> 00:11:46,927
You're holding out on me.

117
00:11:47,007 --> 00:11:50,557
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

118
00:11:50,637 --> 00:11:53,897
and you're covering up
for somebody.

119
00:11:53,977 --> 00:11:56,397
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

120
00:11:56,477 --> 00:12:00,357
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

121
00:12:00,437 --> 00:12:02,567
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

122
00:12:02,647 --> 00:12:05,527
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

123
00:12:05,567 --> 00:12:08,527
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

124
00:12:08,617 --> 00:12:10,537
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

125
00:12:10,617 --> 00:12:12,907
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

126
00:12:12,997 --> 00:12:14,997
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

127
00:12:15,077 --> 00:12:17,077
You gotta write that shit down.

128
00:12:17,127 --> 00:12:19,087
All right, smart-ass.

129
00:12:19,127 --> 00:12:22,217
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

130
00:12:22,257 --> 00:12:26,217
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

131
00:12:26,257 --> 00:12:30,007
- For what?
- Misconduct.

132
00:12:30,097 --> 00:12:34,097
Yeah, give me the lab.

133
00:13:24,857 --> 00:13:27,447
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

134
00:13:27,527 --> 00:13:30,367
- Come here.
- ... three for a girl, four for a boy.

135
00:13:35,407 --> 00:13:39,207
Dancing...

136
00:14:10,317 --> 00:14:12,277
Eric?

137
00:14:14,987 --> 00:14:19,287
Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

138
00:14:19,327 --> 00:14:22,287
Gabriel.

139
00:14:22,337 --> 00:14:25,127
I thought you were dead.

140
00:14:25,167 --> 00:14:28,467
You're not dead, are you?

141
00:14:53,237 --> 00:14:56,157
I knew it was you.

142
00:14:58,077 --> 00:15:00,997
Even with the makeup.

143
00:15:05,837 --> 00:15:08,417
I remembered your song.

144
00:15:08,507 --> 00:15:12,257
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

145
00:15:12,337 --> 00:15:15,597
That is from your song, right?

146
00:15:25,517 --> 00:15:28,647
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

147
00:15:31,027 --> 00:15:35,117
I miss you...
and Shelly.

148
00:15:38,197 --> 00:15:41,657
Get so lonely
all by myself.

149
00:15:43,497 --> 00:15:48,127
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

150
00:15:48,207 --> 00:15:51,337
Sarah, I do care.

151
00:16:02,557 --> 00:16:04,687
That's him.
That's him!

152
00:16:04,767 --> 00:16:08,107
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

153
00:16:08,187 --> 00:16:11,437
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

154
00:16:11,527 --> 00:16:14,067
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

155
00:16:14,157 --> 00:16:16,947
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

156
00:16:17,027 --> 00:16:20,537
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

157
00:16:20,617 --> 00:16:24,537
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

158
00:16:25,877 --> 00:16:30,457
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

159
00:16:30,547 --> 00:16:33,127
- Empty.
- Fire it...

160
00:16:33,217 --> 00:16:35,127
Grave?
What grave?

161
00:16:35,217 --> 00:16:37,427
What about
my fucking grave?

162
00:16:37,507 --> 00:16:38,847
Three out of four.

163
00:16:38,927 --> 00:16:42,177
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

164
00:16:42,267 --> 00:16:44,887
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

165
00:16:44,977 --> 00:16:48,147
That boy was out of control.
T- bird, he came in, he says...

166
00:16:48,227 --> 00:16:51,527
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

167
00:16:55,567 --> 00:16:58,657
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

168
00:16:58,737 --> 00:17:02,497
- This ghost gonna kill...
- Hey.

169
00:17:02,577 --> 00:17:04,537
That ain't no ghost.

170
00:17:06,457 --> 00:17:09,627
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

171
00:17:09,667 --> 00:17:11,667
We might need him.

172
00:17:13,167 --> 00:17:15,627
Ghost gonna kill my...

173
00:17:28,347 --> 00:17:32,317
He like his plain
or with onions?

174
00:17:32,357 --> 00:17:35,817
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

175
00:17:35,857 --> 00:17:39,987
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

176
00:17:40,027 --> 00:17:42,657
That's what I thought.

177
00:17:42,697 --> 00:17:45,497
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

178
00:17:45,537 --> 00:17:47,827
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

179
00:17:47,867 --> 00:17:51,497
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

180
00:17:51,587 --> 00:17:56,917
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

181
00:17:57,007 --> 00:18:00,507
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

182
00:18:00,597 --> 00:18:03,507
Eric didn't come back for me.

183
00:18:03,597 --> 00:18:08,347
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

184
00:18:08,437 --> 00:18:11,607
You want a friend
to walk you home?

185
00:19:45,737 --> 00:19:48,657
Boys.

186
00:19:48,737 --> 00:19:52,157
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

187
00:19:52,247 --> 00:19:54,327
on account of
a slight case of death.

188
00:19:54,417 --> 00:19:56,377
You wanna sit down?

189
00:19:56,457 --> 00:20:01,837
Well, well, well.

190
00:20:01,877 --> 00:20:04,967
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

191
00:20:05,007 --> 00:20:06,967
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

192
00:20:07,007 --> 00:20:10,307
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

193
00:20:10,347 --> 00:20:12,597
I like the pretty lights.

194
00:20:15,607 --> 00:20:19,527
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

195
00:20:19,567 --> 00:20:24,777
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

196
00:20:24,857 --> 00:20:27,237
Only reason to quit.

197
00:20:27,327 --> 00:20:32,827
A man has an idea.

198
00:20:32,907 --> 00:20:35,167
The idea attracts others...

199
00:20:35,247 --> 00:20:37,337
like-minded.

200
00:20:37,417 --> 00:20:39,497
The idea expands.

201
00:20:39,587 --> 00:20:43,217
The idea becomes
an institution.

202
00:20:43,297 --> 00:20:45,967
What was the idea?

203
00:20:46,047 --> 00:20:49,807
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

204
00:20:49,887 --> 00:20:52,677
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

205
00:20:52,767 --> 00:20:55,847
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

206
00:20:55,937 --> 00:20:58,107
You see, gentlemen...

207
00:20:58,187 --> 00:21:03,187
greed is for amateurs.

208
00:21:03,277 --> 00:21:08,447
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

209
00:21:08,527 --> 00:21:11,117
now that's fun!

210
00:21:11,197 --> 00:21:13,497
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

211
00:21:13,577 --> 00:21:16,997
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

212
00:21:17,037 --> 00:21:20,127
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

213
00:21:20,207 --> 00:21:23,667
Do you know
what they got now?

214
00:21:23,707 --> 00:21:28,007
Devil's Night greeting cards.

215
00:21:28,047 --> 00:21:31,007
Isn't that precious?

216
00:21:31,057 --> 00:21:33,177
Yeah.

217
00:21:33,217 --> 00:21:38,017
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

218
00:21:38,057 --> 00:21:40,107
Time to move along.

219
00:21:40,187 --> 00:21:42,607
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

220
00:21:42,687 --> 00:21:45,187
No.

221
00:21:45,237 --> 00:21:47,857
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

222
00:21:47,907 --> 00:21:51,027
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

223
00:21:51,077 --> 00:21:53,697
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

224
00:21:53,737 --> 00:21:58,207
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

225
00:21:58,247 --> 00:22:00,377
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

226
00:22:00,417 --> 00:22:02,377
Skank!
You don't feel that?

227
00:22:02,417 --> 00:22:05,757
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.

228
00:22:05,797 --> 00:22:08,217
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

229
00:22:08,297 --> 00:22:12,677
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

230
00:22:15,137 --> 00:22:17,767
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

231
00:22:19,187 --> 00:22:21,687
Gentlemen.

232
00:22:21,767 --> 00:22:26,397
Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

233
00:22:30,947 --> 00:22:34,737
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

234
00:22:34,787 --> 00:22:37,287
The killer of killers.

235
00:22:37,367 --> 00:22:40,207
Nice outfit.

236
00:22:40,287 --> 00:22:42,337
I'm not sure
about the face though.

237
00:22:42,417 --> 00:22:44,457
I just want him.

238
00:22:44,547 --> 00:22:47,967
Well, you can't have him.

239
00:22:48,047 --> 00:22:50,717
Well...

240
00:22:52,797 --> 00:22:55,257
I see you have
made your decision.

241
00:22:56,847 --> 00:22:58,807
Now let's see you enforce it.

242
00:22:58,887 --> 00:23:02,557
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

243
00:23:08,437 --> 00:23:12,367
Ooh, that had to hurt.

244
00:23:12,447 --> 00:23:15,237
Well, that's that.

245
00:23:15,327 --> 00:23:18,497
That guy was crazy.

246
00:23:25,127 --> 00:23:26,917
He's gone.

247
00:23:34,967 --> 00:23:36,677
Get him!

248
00:23:53,947 --> 00:23:56,737
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

249
00:24:00,787 --> 00:24:02,787
Jesus Christ!

250
00:24:19,217 --> 00:24:21,177
Hey!

251
00:24:53,717 --> 00:24:56,047
You're all going to die.

252
00:25:11,067 --> 00:25:13,897
Get the fuck outta here!

253
00:25:49,687 --> 00:25:52,607
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

254
00:25:52,687 --> 00:25:55,897
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

255
00:25:55,987 --> 00:25:59,867
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

256
00:25:59,947 --> 00:26:01,737
No!

257
00:26:06,367 --> 00:26:10,037
What in the crap...

258
00:26:11,377 --> 00:26:14,007
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

259
00:26:14,087 --> 00:26:17,507
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

260
00:26:26,597 --> 00:26:29,477
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

261
00:26:32,937 --> 00:26:36,567
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

262
00:26:36,647 --> 00:26:38,777
...arms and legs...

263
00:26:44,327 --> 00:26:49,117
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs...

264
00:27:29,747 --> 00:27:34,377
Come on! Move it!

265
00:27:38,797 --> 00:27:41,927
My advice:
Next time duck.

266
00:27:43,967 --> 00:27:46,347
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

267
00:27:49,807 --> 00:27:52,937
Shit!

268
00:27:55,817 --> 00:27:58,727
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

269
00:27:58,817 --> 00:28:01,277
Look at that out there.

270
00:28:01,317 --> 00:28:04,277
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

271
00:28:04,317 --> 00:28:07,537
Sky oughta be red.

272
00:28:07,617 --> 00:28:11,957
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

273
00:28:11,997 --> 00:28:17,707
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

274
00:28:17,797 --> 00:28:20,757
- I like him already.
- The crow...

275
00:28:20,837 --> 00:28:25,297
is his link between
the land of the living...

276
00:28:25,387 --> 00:28:27,717
and the realm of the dead.

277
00:28:27,807 --> 00:28:32,347
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

278
00:28:32,387 --> 00:28:34,397
Hmm.

279
00:28:57,497 --> 00:28:59,497
I'm coming home, Shelly.

280
00:29:48,587 --> 00:29:51,057
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

281
00:29:51,097 --> 00:29:53,177
in the middle
of the night, right?

282
00:29:53,217 --> 00:29:55,017
Safest place in the world to be.

283
00:29:55,057 --> 00:29:59,857
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

284
00:29:59,897 --> 00:30:04,067
It's really late, Sarah.

285
00:30:04,147 --> 00:30:06,897
You didn't say good-bye.

286
00:30:07,027 --> 00:30:10,987
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

287
00:30:11,077 --> 00:30:15,327
And you're never coming back.

288
00:30:21,627 --> 00:30:24,877
I gave this to Shelly once.

289
00:30:28,587 --> 00:30:31,547
I think she'd like you
to have it.

290
00:30:35,597 --> 00:30:37,887
This way you'll
always remember her.

291
00:30:37,937 --> 00:30:40,517
I'll never take it off.

292
00:30:58,657 --> 00:31:02,497
I better go sneak
back in the house.

293
00:31:08,627 --> 00:31:10,587
Bye.

294
00:31:30,567 --> 00:31:33,407
Shh! Shh!

295
00:31:35,327 --> 00:31:37,747
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

296
00:31:44,667 --> 00:31:47,127
Come on.
Come on.

297
00:32:00,427 --> 00:32:04,557
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

298
00:32:06,147 --> 00:32:09,277
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

299
00:32:15,697 --> 00:32:18,997
Her eyes are so innocent.

300
00:32:30,337 --> 00:32:32,297
Eric!

301
00:32:32,337 --> 00:32:36,297
Eric, help! Eric!

302
00:33:15,757 --> 00:33:18,967
Quick impression for ya.

303
00:33:19,057 --> 00:33:22,767
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

304
00:33:22,847 --> 00:33:26,187
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

305
00:33:26,267 --> 00:33:29,317
Well, well.

306
00:33:29,397 --> 00:33:33,147
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

307
00:33:41,117 --> 00:33:43,407
Nah. Fuck it.

308
00:33:51,877 --> 00:33:54,007
Aw, fuck.

309
00:34:01,257 --> 00:34:05,807
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

310
00:34:05,887 --> 00:34:09,727
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

311
00:34:14,067 --> 00:34:17,447
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

312
00:34:20,987 --> 00:34:23,237
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

313
00:34:24,907 --> 00:34:27,117
Bye-bye, birdie.

314
00:35:12,207 --> 00:35:14,337
Ah, shit.

315
00:35:14,377 --> 00:35:16,507
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

316
00:35:16,547 --> 00:35:18,587
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

317
00:35:18,667 --> 00:35:21,257
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

318
00:35:21,337 --> 00:35:23,347
Two more.

319
00:35:23,387 --> 00:35:25,387
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

320
00:35:25,467 --> 00:35:28,017
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

321
00:35:28,057 --> 00:35:30,847
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

322
00:35:30,897 --> 00:35:34,647
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

323
00:35:37,277 --> 00:35:40,817
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

324
00:35:40,907 --> 00:35:42,947
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

325
00:35:43,027 --> 00:35:46,487
I was.
I'm not anymore.

326
00:35:46,577 --> 00:35:50,787
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

327
00:35:50,867 --> 00:35:53,787
Come on.

328
00:35:56,457 --> 00:35:58,507
You take that.

329
00:36:28,577 --> 00:36:32,037
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

330
00:36:56,147 --> 00:36:59,397
This is all the power
you ever had.

331
00:36:59,437 --> 00:37:01,567
Now it is mine.

332
00:37:01,607 --> 00:37:05,317
Pity there's not more time...

333
00:37:05,407 --> 00:37:08,027
...for us.

334
00:37:26,177 --> 00:37:29,007
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

335
00:37:31,137 --> 00:37:33,677
Let me go!

336
00:37:42,777 --> 00:37:46,317
Let her go!

337
00:37:46,357 --> 00:37:49,277
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

338
00:37:49,277 --> 00:37:50,987
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

339
00:37:51,037 --> 00:37:53,037
All right.

340
00:37:53,117 --> 00:37:55,157
No!

341
00:38:41,587 --> 00:38:43,047
Eric!

342
00:39:01,647 --> 00:39:04,977
- Sarah?
- Look out!

343
00:39:08,567 --> 00:39:12,067
Eric!

344
00:39:20,077 --> 00:39:22,247
You know,
my daddy used to say...

345
00:39:22,337 --> 00:39:24,837
"Every man's got a devil...

346
00:39:24,917 --> 00:39:27,047
and you can't rest
till you find him."

347
00:39:27,127 --> 00:39:29,677
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend...

348
00:39:29,757 --> 00:39:32,677
I cleared that building.

349
00:39:32,757 --> 00:39:36,017
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

350
00:39:36,097 --> 00:39:38,937
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

351
00:39:39,017 --> 00:39:41,847
But if it's any consolation
to you...

352
00:39:41,937 --> 00:39:45,567
you have put
a smile on my face.

353
00:39:45,647 --> 00:39:48,277
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

354
00:39:48,317 --> 00:39:50,947
I am going to miss you.

355
00:39:50,987 --> 00:39:53,527
I have something
to give you.

356
00:39:53,617 --> 00:39:55,987
I don't want it anymore.

357
00:40:00,497 --> 00:40:03,497
Thirty hours of pain!

358
00:40:05,837 --> 00:40:08,547
All at once!

359
00:40:08,627 --> 00:40:11,627
All for you.

360
00:40:37,237 --> 00:40:40,407
Yeah.

361
00:40:47,247 --> 00:40:50,087
Go help him.

362
00:40:53,427 --> 00:40:55,717
Are you alive?

363
00:40:57,717 --> 00:41:01,727
God, I need a cigarette.

364
00:41:07,687 --> 00:41:09,647
Everybody else dead?

365
00:41:09,687 --> 00:41:11,987
You helped me.

366
00:41:12,067 --> 00:41:14,607
What you kept in here
saved me.

367
00:41:14,697 --> 00:41:17,827
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

368
00:41:17,907 --> 00:41:20,907
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

369
00:41:25,917 --> 00:41:28,667
Oh, yuck.

370
00:41:28,747 --> 00:41:33,757
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

371
00:41:42,227 --> 00:41:45,687
Stay with him
until help comes.

372
00:41:45,727 --> 00:41:49,187
He'll be okay, right?

373
00:41:49,267 --> 00:41:51,477
Eric?

374
00:41:52,937 --> 00:41:56,527
He does that a lot.

375
00:42:12,797 --> 00:42:15,257
Shelly.

376
00:42:27,477 --> 00:42:32,317
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

377
00:42:32,397 --> 00:42:35,107
At least it stopped raining, huh?

378
00:42:35,147 --> 00:42:38,567
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

379
00:42:38,657 --> 00:42:41,987
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

380
00:42:42,027 --> 00:42:43,997
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

381
00:42:44,037 --> 00:42:48,617
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

382
00:42:48,707 --> 00:42:50,747
You missed it.

383
00:42:50,837 --> 00:42:53,497
Get him outta here!

384
00:43:57,687 --> 00:43:59,647
Thanks.

385
00:44:04,867 --> 00:44:07,907
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

386
00:44:07,997 --> 00:44:13,077
the way to have them live on
is to never stop loving them.

387
00:44:13,167 --> 00:44:19,047
Buildings burn, people die,
but real love is forever.

388
00:51:52,107 --> 00:51:54,357
You again.

389
00:51:54,447 --> 00:51:56,817
You lost or hungry?

390
00:51:56,867 --> 00:51:59,697
Hi.

391
00:52:17,637 --> 00:52:20,347
I don't know how many times I
gotta tell you. We're in this together!

392
00:52:20,427 --> 00:52:23,347
One part falls, it all falls!

393
00:52:23,427 --> 00:52:26,897
- You know how long it took us to put this together?
- Yeah, a long time.

394
00:52:26,937 --> 00:52:29,517
That piece of ratshit made Tin Tin
into a fucking voodoo doll!

395
00:52:29,607 --> 00:52:31,687
Tin Tin was a dick.

396
00:52:31,777 --> 00:52:34,737
Tin Tin.
Sheesh.

397
00:52:34,817 --> 00:52:39,027
Fire it up! Fire it up!
Fire it up! Fire it up!

398
00:52:39,117 --> 00:52:41,027
Fire it up!

399
00:52:43,617 --> 00:52:45,707
No Funboy.

400
00:52:45,787 --> 00:52:49,707
Probably still...
banging away on Darla.

401
00:52:55,087 --> 00:52:58,177
Smokes and road beers.
Be quick.

402
00:52:58,257 --> 00:53:00,257
I'm on it.

403
00:53:30,917 --> 00:53:34,497
What the fuck are
you supposed to be, man?

404
00:53:34,587 --> 00:53:39,217
I'm your passenger.

405
00:53:46,097 --> 00:53:48,267
Drive.

406
00:53:53,357 --> 00:53:55,147
What's all this
happy horseshit?

407
00:53:55,227 --> 00:53:57,357
Hey, T-bird! T-bird!

408
00:54:02,777 --> 00:54:06,037
- Oh, shit!
- What the fuck's the matter with you?

409
00:54:06,117 --> 00:54:10,117
Stupid asshair!
You hit my car!

410
00:54:17,087 --> 00:54:21,507
What do you want, man?
Money? Drugs? I got it.

411
00:54:23,137 --> 00:54:26,007
We could use you.
You did Tin Tin.

412
00:54:26,097 --> 00:54:29,177
- This is business, right?
- Faster.

413
00:54:32,147 --> 00:54:36,357
You got that cream stuff?

414
00:54:36,397 --> 00:54:38,817
I hate this.
They can't even call it cream legally.

415
00:54:40,397 --> 00:54:43,407
What in the crap...

416
00:54:46,907 --> 00:54:49,747
Oh, look. Making us popular.

417
00:54:49,787 --> 00:54:52,497
When they flash us like that,
they ain't friends.

418
00:54:58,087 --> 00:55:01,047
This is Vehicle 48. We got us
a big, old, red hot rod.

419
00:55:03,587 --> 00:55:05,757
Turn.

420
00:55:07,097 --> 00:55:09,847
You got something personal, amigo,
we can work it out.

421
00:55:09,927 --> 00:55:14,267
Right? Huh?

422
00:55:15,807 --> 00:55:18,317
Damn! Dead end!

423
00:55:23,697 --> 00:55:26,157
Look out!

424
00:55:29,487 --> 00:55:31,707
Oh, my God!
Get outta the way!

425
00:55:42,797 --> 00:55:47,047
Holy shit! Goddamn foreign cars!

426
00:55:50,717 --> 00:55:53,227
Shit! Shit!

427
00:56:00,357 --> 00:56:04,067
Oh, I hate this.
This ain't good.

428
00:56:05,487 --> 00:56:08,947
T- bird!
I got you, man!

429
00:56:09,027 --> 00:56:11,407
Shit!

430
00:56:24,797 --> 00:56:27,087
Remember?
Yeah, I remember everything.

431
00:56:27,177 --> 00:56:30,427
But I don't know what...
What? Huh? What?

432
00:56:30,467 --> 00:56:33,267
What are you talking about?
No, no, no, no, no.

433
00:56:33,307 --> 00:56:36,437
You mean that place downtown?
Yeah, I remember her.

434
00:56:36,477 --> 00:56:38,647
We needed to put some fear
into that little lady.

435
00:56:38,727 --> 00:56:41,977
She wasn't going along
with our tenant relocation program.

436
00:56:42,067 --> 00:56:45,647
And her idiot boyfriend shows up
and turns a simple sweep-and-clear...

437
00:56:45,737 --> 00:56:49,157
into a total cluster fuck!
Who gives a shit?

438
00:56:49,237 --> 00:56:52,487
It's ancient history!
Why? What do you want?

439
00:56:52,577 --> 00:56:57,497
What is it? What?
Speak to me. Speak!

440
00:56:59,077 --> 00:57:00,957
Did you send us
these complaints?

441
00:57:02,667 --> 00:57:06,007
Come here!
"Abashed the devil stood."

442
00:57:06,047 --> 00:57:08,427
Does it get you sweaty?

443
00:57:08,507 --> 00:57:13,717
I know you. I know you.
I knew I knew you.

444
00:57:13,767 --> 00:57:17,847
I knew I knew you.
But you ain't you.

445
00:57:18,017 --> 00:57:21,937
You can't be you. We put you through
the window. There ain't no coming back.

446
00:57:22,017 --> 00:57:25,487
This is the really real world.
There ain't no coming back.

447
00:57:25,527 --> 00:57:27,897
We killed you dead.
There ain't no coming back.

448
00:57:27,987 --> 00:57:32,447
T- bird...

449
00:57:32,527 --> 00:57:35,497
There ain't no coming back!
There ain't no coming back!

450
00:57:38,037 --> 00:57:42,207
T- bird.

451
00:57:42,287 --> 00:57:45,667
"Abashed the devil stood...

452
00:57:45,707 --> 00:57:48,677
and felt how awful goodness is."

453
00:57:48,757 --> 00:57:51,637
"And felt how awful goodness is."

454
00:58:05,687 --> 00:58:08,277
T- bird. T-bird.

455
00:58:58,657 --> 00:59:00,957
This is the 7:00 a.m. edition
of Action News.

456
00:59:01,037 --> 00:59:03,377
For over a decade,
the night before Halloween...

457
00:59:03,417 --> 00:59:07,797
has had a darker and deadlier nickname
in the inner city, "Devil's Night"...

458
00:59:07,877 --> 00:59:11,297
the name given to what has become
an annual plague of arson.

459
00:59:11,377 --> 00:59:16,757
Last year over 200 blazes were reported,
and 11 people lost their lives.

460
00:59:16,807 --> 00:59:21,977
Tonight may become the biggest
and deadliest Devil's Night ever.

461
00:59:22,057 --> 00:59:25,687
The mayor has fire fighters
from all surrounding counties...

462
00:59:25,767 --> 00:59:29,567
Do you like them up or over?
I can't remember.

463
00:59:31,607 --> 00:59:34,317
What are you doing?
I don't even like eggs.

464
00:59:34,407 --> 00:59:39,327
- Wait, you loved eggs.
- Yeah, when I was five.

465
00:59:39,407 --> 00:59:43,537
So what do you want now?
Black coffee and cigarettes?

466
00:59:43,617 --> 00:59:46,957
So what did you take
to become mother of the year?

467
00:59:46,997 --> 00:59:52,127
Oh, it wasn't drugs.
Someone kind of woke me up.

468
00:59:52,167 --> 00:59:57,967
- Who?
- Oh, it was nuts.

469
00:59:58,007 --> 01:00:03,267
You're acting weird. Did you win
the lottery or something, Darla?

470
01:00:05,767 --> 01:00:10,067
Oh, forget it. I never was
too good at this mommy shit.

471
01:00:10,147 --> 01:00:12,357
Over easy.

472
01:00:14,447 --> 01:00:19,157
I like 'em
over easy... Mom.

473
01:00:29,747 --> 01:00:32,007
Hey, Albrecht.

474
01:00:34,757 --> 01:00:37,677
This is the third hit
in your hood in 24 hours.

475
01:00:37,757 --> 01:00:41,007
We just fished this out of the river.
He's fused to his own car.

476
01:00:41,097 --> 01:00:45,307
- We're gonna have to I.D. his teeth.
- His name is T-bird.

477
01:00:45,387 --> 01:00:47,307
Arson was his specialty.

478
01:00:47,397 --> 01:00:49,357
Looks like he zigged
when he should have zagged.

479
01:00:49,437 --> 01:00:53,357
- Case closed.
- Bull-fuckin'- shit.

480
01:00:53,437 --> 01:00:55,697
Come here.

481
01:00:59,447 --> 01:01:01,407
You're holding out on me.

482
01:01:01,487 --> 01:01:05,037
I got a goddamn vigilante killer
knocking off scumbags left and right...

483
01:01:05,117 --> 01:01:08,377
and you're covering up
for somebody.

484
01:01:08,457 --> 01:01:10,877
Who's the cartoon character
in the painted face?

485
01:01:10,957 --> 01:01:14,837
- You're the detective. You tell me.
- Okay.

486
01:01:14,917 --> 01:01:17,047
Gideon's blows all to hell and you're
having a chitchat with some weirdo...

487
01:01:17,127 --> 01:01:20,007
who winds up in T-bird's car
when it zigs instead of zags.

488
01:01:20,047 --> 01:01:23,007
Then you steal one of
my case files from homicide...

489
01:01:23,097 --> 01:01:25,017
and you're saying this is
just a fucking automobile accident?

490
01:01:25,097 --> 01:01:27,387
- Come on!
- Yeah. Good speech though.

491
01:01:27,477 --> 01:01:29,477
I didn't want to interrupt you.
It sounded good.

492
01:01:29,557 --> 01:01:31,557
You gotta write that shit down.

493
01:01:31,607 --> 01:01:33,567
All right, smart-ass.

494
01:01:33,607 --> 01:01:36,697
The captain's got a little
love note waiting for you.

495
01:01:36,737 --> 01:01:40,697
- Welcome to the first day of the rest of your suspension.
- Suspension?

496
01:01:40,737 --> 01:01:44,487
- For what?
- Misconduct.

497
01:01:44,577 --> 01:01:48,577
Yeah, give me the lab.

498
01:02:39,337 --> 01:02:41,927
One for sorrow,
two for joy...

499
01:02:42,007 --> 01:02:44,847
- Come here.
- ... three for a girl, four for a boy.

500
01:02:49,887 --> 01:02:53,687
Dancing...

501
01:03:24,797 --> 01:03:26,757
Eric?

502
01:03:29,467 --> 01:03:33,767
Man, Sarah,
you're going crazy.

503
01:03:33,807 --> 01:03:36,767
Gabriel.

504
01:03:36,817 --> 01:03:39,607
I thought you were dead.

505
01:03:39,647 --> 01:03:42,947
You're not dead, are you?

506
01:04:07,717 --> 01:04:10,637
I knew it was you.

507
01:04:12,557 --> 01:04:15,477
Even with the makeup.

508
01:04:20,317 --> 01:04:22,897
I remembered your song.

509
01:04:22,987 --> 01:04:26,737
You said,
"Can't rain all the time."

510
01:04:26,817 --> 01:04:30,077
That is from your song, right?

511
01:04:39,997 --> 01:04:43,127
Come on, Eric. I know you're here.

512
01:04:45,507 --> 01:04:49,597
I miss you...
and Shelly.

513
01:04:52,677 --> 01:04:56,137
Get so lonely
all by myself.

514
01:04:57,977 --> 01:05:02,607
The hell with you.
I thought you cared.

515
01:05:02,687 --> 01:05:05,817
Sarah, I do care.

516
01:05:17,037 --> 01:05:19,167
That's him.
That's him!

517
01:05:19,247 --> 01:05:22,587
But he looked different. He was painted
up white like some kind of dead whore.

518
01:05:22,667 --> 01:05:25,917
I seen him. T-bird sent me in
for some road beers, right?

519
01:05:26,007 --> 01:05:28,547
Then he took him away.
But I chased him down.

520
01:05:28,637 --> 01:05:31,427
And he flash fried T-bird
to his fucking car!

521
01:05:31,507 --> 01:05:35,017
Aw, T-bird!
Here's to you, buddy.

522
01:05:35,097 --> 01:05:39,017
Maybe we oughta just videotape this.
Play it back in slow motion.

523
01:05:40,357 --> 01:05:44,937
- Fire it up! Fire it up!
- You see the grave?

524
01:05:45,027 --> 01:05:47,607
- Empty.
- Fire it...

525
01:05:47,697 --> 01:05:49,607
Grave?
What grave?

526
01:05:49,697 --> 01:05:51,907
What about
my fucking grave?

527
01:05:51,987 --> 01:05:53,327
Three out of four.

528
01:05:53,407 --> 01:05:56,657
He's working his way back
to this speed freak right here.

529
01:05:56,747 --> 01:05:59,367
It's not fair.
It's Funboy's fault.

530
01:05:59,457 --> 01:06:02,627
That boy was out of control.
T- bird, he came in, he says...

531
01:06:02,707 --> 01:06:06,007
..."Waste them both." And now
this ghost gonna kill my ass next!

532
01:06:10,047 --> 01:06:13,137
This ghost gonna
kill my ass next.

533
01:06:13,217 --> 01:06:16,977
- This ghost gonna kill...
- Hey.

534
01:06:17,057 --> 01:06:19,017
That ain't no ghost.

535
01:06:20,937 --> 01:06:24,107
- They have all arrived.
- Watch him.

536
01:06:24,147 --> 01:06:26,147
We might need him.

537
01:06:27,647 --> 01:06:30,107
Ghost gonna kill my...

538
01:06:42,827 --> 01:06:46,797
He like his plain
or with onions?

539
01:06:46,837 --> 01:06:50,297
Fine.
Don't talk to me.

540
01:06:50,337 --> 01:06:54,467
When someone's dead,
they can't come back, can they?

541
01:06:54,507 --> 01:06:57,137
That's what I thought.

542
01:06:57,177 --> 01:06:59,977
Are you referring
to anyone in particular?

543
01:07:00,017 --> 01:07:02,307
You'll just think
I'm nuts.

544
01:07:02,347 --> 01:07:05,977
Yeah, well, then maybe
they'll have to lock us both up.

545
01:07:06,067 --> 01:07:11,397
- You see him too?
- I saw somebody.

546
01:07:11,487 --> 01:07:14,987
Maybe it was
your fairy godfather.

547
01:07:15,077 --> 01:07:17,987
Eric didn't come back for me.

548
01:07:18,077 --> 01:07:22,827
He can't be my friend anymore
because I'm alive.

549
01:07:22,917 --> 01:07:26,087
You want a friend
to walk you home?

550
01:09:00,217 --> 01:09:03,137
Boys.

551
01:09:03,217 --> 01:09:06,637
It seems our friend T-bird won't be
joining us this evening...

552
01:09:06,727 --> 01:09:08,807
on account of
a slight case of death.

553
01:09:08,897 --> 01:09:10,857
You wanna sit down?

554
01:09:10,937 --> 01:09:16,317
Well, well, well.

555
01:09:16,357 --> 01:09:19,447
Devil's Night is
upon us again.

556
01:09:19,487 --> 01:09:21,447
I thought we'd throw
a little party...

557
01:09:21,487 --> 01:09:24,787
start a bunch of fires,
make a little profit.

558
01:09:24,827 --> 01:09:27,077
I like the pretty lights.

559
01:09:30,087 --> 01:09:34,007
Problem is, it's all been done before.
You see what I'm saying?

560
01:09:34,047 --> 01:09:39,257
- That's no reason to quit.
- Wrong. Best reason to quit.

561
01:09:39,337 --> 01:09:41,717
Only reason to quit.

562
01:09:41,807 --> 01:09:47,307
A man has an idea.

563
01:09:47,387 --> 01:09:49,647
The idea attracts others...

564
01:09:49,727 --> 01:09:51,817
like-minded.

565
01:09:51,897 --> 01:09:53,977
The idea expands.

566
01:09:54,067 --> 01:09:57,697
The idea becomes
an institution.

567
01:09:57,777 --> 01:10:00,447
What was the idea?

568
01:10:00,527 --> 01:10:04,287
See, that's what's
been bothering me, boys.

569
01:10:04,367 --> 01:10:07,157
But I'll tell ya, when I used
to think about the idea itself...

570
01:10:07,247 --> 01:10:10,327
it'd put a big old smile on my face.

571
01:10:10,417 --> 01:10:12,587
You see, gentlemen...

572
01:10:12,667 --> 01:10:17,667
greed is for amateurs.

573
01:10:17,757 --> 01:10:22,927
Disorder, chaos, anarchy...

574
01:10:23,007 --> 01:10:25,597
now that's fun!

575
01:10:25,677 --> 01:10:27,977
- What about Devil's Night?
- What about it?

576
01:10:28,057 --> 01:10:31,477
I started the first fires
in this goddamn city.

577
01:10:31,517 --> 01:10:34,607
Before I knew it, every charlatan
and shitheel was imitating me.

578
01:10:34,687 --> 01:10:38,147
Do you know
what they got now?

579
01:10:38,187 --> 01:10:42,487
Devil's Night greeting cards.

580
01:10:42,527 --> 01:10:45,487
Isn't that precious?

581
01:10:45,537 --> 01:10:47,657
Yeah.

582
01:10:47,697 --> 01:10:52,497
The idea has become
the institution, boys.

583
01:10:52,537 --> 01:10:54,587
Time to move along.

584
01:10:54,667 --> 01:10:57,087
You don't want us to do
"Light My Fire" time for the whole city?

585
01:10:57,167 --> 01:10:59,667
No.

586
01:10:59,717 --> 01:11:02,337
No, I want you to set
a fire so goddamn big...

587
01:11:02,387 --> 01:11:05,507
the gods will notice us again.
That's what I'm saying.

588
01:11:05,557 --> 01:11:08,177
I want all of you boys to be able
to look me straight in the eye...

589
01:11:08,217 --> 01:11:12,687
one more time and say,
"Are we having fun or what?"

590
01:11:12,727 --> 01:11:14,857
- Hey, you! What's your name?
- Huh?

591
01:11:14,897 --> 01:11:16,857
Skank!
You don't feel that?

592
01:11:16,897 --> 01:11:20,237
- I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook.

593
01:11:20,277 --> 01:11:22,697
"I feel like a little worm
on a big fucking hook."

594
01:11:22,777 --> 01:11:27,157
Well, boy, your mama
must be damn proud of you!

595
01:11:29,617 --> 01:11:32,247
How the hell did
that thing get in here?

596
01:11:33,667 --> 01:11:36,167
Gentlemen.

597
01:11:36,247 --> 01:11:40,877
Let me go!
Let me go! I gotta go!

598
01:11:45,427 --> 01:11:49,217
You're him, huh?
The avenger.

599
01:11:49,267 --> 01:11:51,767
The killer of killers.

600
01:11:51,847 --> 01:11:54,687
Nice outfit.

601
01:11:54,767 --> 01:11:56,817
I'm not sure
about the face though.

602
01:11:56,897 --> 01:11:58,937
I just want him.

603
01:11:59,027 --> 01:12:02,447
Well, you can't have him.

604
01:12:02,527 --> 01:12:05,197
Well...

605
01:12:07,277 --> 01:12:09,737
I see you have
made your decision.

606
01:12:11,327 --> 01:12:13,287
Now let's see you enforce it.

607
01:12:13,367 --> 01:12:17,037
Aw, this is already boring the shit
out of me. Kill him!

608
01:12:22,917 --> 01:12:26,847
Ooh, that had to hurt.

609
01:12:26,927 --> 01:12:29,717
Well, that's that.

610
01:12:29,807 --> 01:12:32,977
That guy was crazy.

611
01:12:39,607 --> 01:12:41,397
He's gone.

612
01:12:49,447 --> 01:12:51,157
Get him!

613
01:13:08,427 --> 01:13:11,217
Right here! Here, help me!
He's gonna kill me!

614
01:13:15,267 --> 01:13:17,267
Jesus Christ!

615
01:13:33,697 --> 01:13:35,657
Hey!

616
01:14:08,197 --> 01:14:10,527
You're all going to die.

617
01:14:25,547 --> 01:14:28,377
Get the fuck outta here!

618
01:15:04,167 --> 01:15:07,087
Guess it's not a good day
to be a bad guy, huh, Skank?

619
01:15:07,167 --> 01:15:10,377
I'm not Skank.
There's Skank right there.

620
01:15:10,467 --> 01:15:14,347
- Skank's dead.
- That's right.

621
01:15:14,427 --> 01:15:16,217
No!

622
01:15:20,847 --> 01:15:24,517
What in the crap...

623
01:15:25,857 --> 01:15:28,487
- Don't move!
- Hold it!

624
01:15:28,567 --> 01:15:31,987
That's all she wrote!
Move and we shoot!

625
01:15:41,077 --> 01:15:43,957
You are surrounded by police units.
Do not attempt to escape.

626
01:15:47,417 --> 01:15:51,047
- Stop running immediately.
- Holy shit!

627
01:15:51,127 --> 01:15:53,257
...arms and legs...

628
01:15:58,807 --> 01:16:03,597
Stop immediately.
Lie down, spread your arms and legs...

629
01:16:44,227 --> 01:16:48,857
Come on! Move it!

630
01:16:53,277 --> 01:16:56,407
My advice:
Next time duck.

631
01:16:58,447 --> 01:17:00,827
So many cops, you'd think
they were giving away donuts.

632
01:17:04,287 --> 01:17:07,417
Shit!

633
01:17:10,297 --> 01:17:13,207
Oh. I knew you
were gonna do that.

634
01:17:13,297 --> 01:17:15,757
Look at that out there.

635
01:17:15,797 --> 01:17:18,757
The whole city oughta be
in flames by now.

636
01:17:18,797 --> 01:17:22,017
Sky oughta be red.

637
01:17:22,097 --> 01:17:26,437
So that, I take it,
is the late, great Eric Draven.

638
01:17:26,477 --> 01:17:32,187
He has power, but it is power
you can take from him.

639
01:17:32,277 --> 01:17:35,237
- I like him already.
- The crow...

640
01:17:35,317 --> 01:17:39,777
is his link between
the land of the living...

641
01:17:39,867 --> 01:17:42,197
and the realm of the dead.

642
01:17:42,287 --> 01:17:46,827
So, kill the crow
and destroy the man.

643
01:17:46,867 --> 01:17:48,877
Hmm.

644
01:18:11,977 --> 01:18:13,977
I'm coming home, Shelly.

645
01:19:03,067 --> 01:19:05,537
You're gonna say
I shouldn't be in the cemetery...

646
01:19:05,577 --> 01:19:07,657
in the middle
of the night, right?

647
01:19:07,697 --> 01:19:09,497
Safest place in the world to be.

648
01:19:09,537 --> 01:19:14,337
It's 'cause everybody's dead.
I knew you'd come here.

649
01:19:14,377 --> 01:19:18,547
It's really late, Sarah.

650
01:19:18,627 --> 01:19:21,377
You didn't say good-bye.

651
01:19:21,507 --> 01:19:25,467
You're just gonna have
to forgive me for that.

652
01:19:25,557 --> 01:19:29,807
And you're never coming back.

653
01:19:36,107 --> 01:19:39,357
I gave this to Shelly once.

654
01:19:43,067 --> 01:19:46,027
I think she'd like you
to have it.

655
01:19:50,077 --> 01:19:52,367
This way you'll
always remember her.

656
01:19:52,417 --> 01:19:54,997
I'll never take it off.

657
01:20:13,137 --> 01:20:16,977
I better go sneak
back in the house.

658
01:20:23,107 --> 01:20:25,067
Bye.

659
01:20:45,047 --> 01:20:47,887
Shh! Shh!

660
01:20:49,807 --> 01:20:52,227
Shh. Take it easy, sweetheart.

661
01:20:59,147 --> 01:21:01,607
Come on.
Come on.

662
01:21:14,907 --> 01:21:19,037
What is that? Some sort of souvenir
there from your pal?

663
01:21:20,627 --> 01:21:23,757
I'll just keep it for good luck.
What do you say, hmm?

664
01:21:30,177 --> 01:21:33,477
Her eyes are so innocent.

665
01:21:44,817 --> 01:21:46,777
Eric!

666
01:21:46,817 --> 01:21:50,777
Eric, help! Eric!

667
01:22:30,237 --> 01:22:33,447
Quick impression for ya.

668
01:22:33,537 --> 01:22:37,247
Caw! Caw! Bang!
Fuck, I'm dead!

669
01:22:37,327 --> 01:22:40,667
Give me the girl
and I'll let you walk out of here.

670
01:22:40,747 --> 01:22:43,797
Well, well.

671
01:22:43,877 --> 01:22:47,627
Why don't you just give me a minute
to think about that, huh?

672
01:22:55,597 --> 01:22:57,887
Nah. Fuck it.

673
01:23:06,357 --> 01:23:08,487
Aw, fuck.

674
01:23:15,737 --> 01:23:20,287
Well, well, well. It does seem to me
that our little life has undergone...

675
01:23:20,367 --> 01:23:24,207
a rather significant change in the past
few minutes now. Wouldn't you agree?

676
01:23:28,547 --> 01:23:31,927
Well, for a ghost,
you bleed just fine.

677
01:23:35,467 --> 01:23:37,717
- It's still alive.
- Well, then kill it!

678
01:23:39,387 --> 01:23:41,597
Bye-bye, birdie.

679
01:24:26,687 --> 01:24:28,817
Ah, shit.

680
01:24:28,857 --> 01:24:30,987
Well, just came by
to pay my respects...

681
01:24:31,027 --> 01:24:33,067
and here you are
getting all shot up again.

682
01:24:33,147 --> 01:24:35,737
- They've taken Sarah.
- How many?

683
01:24:35,817 --> 01:24:37,827
Two more.

684
01:24:37,867 --> 01:24:39,867
I can handle it.
Don't worry.

685
01:24:39,947 --> 01:24:42,497
I'm not worried.
Look, here's the plan.

686
01:24:42,537 --> 01:24:45,327
You stay in front, and when they
run out of ammo, I'll arrest 'em.

687
01:24:45,377 --> 01:24:49,127
That sounds like a great plan.
There's just one problem.

688
01:24:51,757 --> 01:24:55,297
Oh, shit.
You're bleeding all over the place.

689
01:24:55,387 --> 01:24:57,427
I thought, you know,
you were invincible.

690
01:24:57,507 --> 01:25:00,967
I was.
I'm not anymore.

691
01:25:01,057 --> 01:25:05,267
Well, I guess you really will
need my help, won't you?

692
01:25:05,347 --> 01:25:08,267
Come on.

693
01:25:10,937 --> 01:25:12,987
You take that.

694
01:25:43,057 --> 01:25:46,517
- You were supposed to stay behind me.
- I think I messed up.

695
01:26:10,627 --> 01:26:13,877
This is all the power
you ever had.

696
01:26:13,917 --> 01:26:16,047
Now it is mine.

697
01:26:16,087 --> 01:26:19,797
Pity there's not more time...

698
01:26:19,887 --> 01:26:22,507
...for us.

699
01:26:40,657 --> 01:26:43,487
Help, Eric!
I'm scared!

700
01:26:45,617 --> 01:26:48,157
Let me go!

701
01:26:57,257 --> 01:27:00,797
Let her go!

702
01:27:00,837 --> 01:27:03,757
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

703
01:27:03,757 --> 01:27:05,467
You can have me.
I won't fight you.

704
01:27:05,517 --> 01:27:07,517
All right.

705
01:27:07,597 --> 01:27:09,637
No!

706
01:27:56,067 --> 01:27:57,527
Eric!

707
01:28:16,127 --> 01:28:19,457
- Sarah?
- Look out!

708
01:28:23,047 --> 01:28:26,547
Eric!

709
01:28:34,557 --> 01:28:36,727
You know,
my daddy used to say...

710
01:28:36,817 --> 01:28:39,317
"Every man's got a devil...

711
01:28:39,397 --> 01:28:41,527
and you can't rest
till you find him."

712
01:28:41,607 --> 01:28:44,157
What happened back there
with you and your girlfriend...

713
01:28:44,237 --> 01:28:47,157
I cleared that building.

714
01:28:47,237 --> 01:28:50,497
Hell, nothing in this town
happens without my say-so.

715
01:28:50,577 --> 01:28:53,417
So I'm sorry if I spoiled
your wedding plans, friend.

716
01:28:53,497 --> 01:28:56,327
But if it's any consolation
to you...

717
01:28:56,417 --> 01:29:00,047
you have put
a smile on my face.

718
01:29:00,127 --> 01:29:02,757
You got a lot
of spirit, son.

719
01:29:02,797 --> 01:29:05,427
I am going to miss you.

720
01:29:05,467 --> 01:29:08,007
I have something
to give you.

721
01:29:08,097 --> 01:29:10,467
I don't want it anymore.

722
01:29:14,977 --> 01:29:17,977
Thirty hours of pain!

723
01:29:20,317 --> 01:29:23,027
All at once!

724
01:29:23,107 --> 01:29:26,107
All for you.

725
01:29:51,717 --> 01:29:54,887
Yeah.

726
01:30:01,727 --> 01:30:04,567
Go help him.

727
01:30:07,907 --> 01:30:10,197
Are you alive?

728
01:30:12,197 --> 01:30:16,207
God, I need a cigarette.

729
01:30:22,167 --> 01:30:24,127
Everybody else dead?

730
01:30:24,167 --> 01:30:26,467
You helped me.

731
01:30:26,547 --> 01:30:29,087
What you kept in here
saved me.

732
01:30:29,177 --> 01:30:32,307
- Thanks.
- Don't mention it.

733
01:30:32,387 --> 01:30:35,387
I've been meaning
to come to church anyway.

734
01:30:40,397 --> 01:30:43,147
Oh, yuck.

735
01:30:43,227 --> 01:30:48,237
I'm quitting as of now...
if I live.

736
01:30:56,707 --> 01:31:00,167
Stay with him
until help comes.

737
01:31:00,207 --> 01:31:03,667
He'll be okay, right?

738
01:31:03,747 --> 01:31:05,957
Eric?

739
01:31:07,417 --> 01:31:11,007
He does that a lot.

740
01:31:27,277 --> 01:31:29,737
Shelly.

741
01:31:41,957 --> 01:31:46,797
- All right, what's going on in there?
- Multiple homicides.

742
01:31:46,877 --> 01:31:49,587
At least it stopped raining, huh?

743
01:31:49,627 --> 01:31:53,047
- It can't rain all the time.
- No, I don't believe it.

744
01:31:53,137 --> 01:31:56,467
- This nightmare your fault, Albrecht?
- Look, you go on home.

745
01:31:56,507 --> 01:31:58,477
- I'm okay.
- Okay.

746
01:31:58,517 --> 01:32:03,097
- Want to tell me what's going on?
- Your vigilante's up on the roof.

747
01:32:03,187 --> 01:32:05,227
You missed it.

748
01:32:05,317 --> 01:32:07,977
Get him outta here!

749
01:33:12,167 --> 01:33:14,127
Thanks.

750
01:33:19,347 --> 01:33:22,387
If the people we love
are stolen from us...

751
